extendedInfo.description: This version of Royal Sails contains ads.Royal Sails is an action/adventure game from CODE FORGE GAMESThe Caribbean, XVI Century. English privateers are steadily increasing their attacks on the Spanish supply lines, and the war between England and Spain is drawing near. You, as Sir William Hawkins, Captain of the Royal Navy, will take part in fight against the Spanish armada in the West Indies. During the course of your career you will take part in raids on enemy cities, plunder treasure fleets and fight in intense naval battles, to secure the dominance of the British Empire in the Caribbean.Awards & ReviewÂ --Â * Best Apps AwardÂ "(...) everything is done in the service of the action, and that's the way a privateer likes it. -- Keoni C." - BestAppsMarket.comÂ Royal Sails features:--Battle through 20 exciting missionsTake command of 4 deadly warshipsTake down your enemies with 3 different weapons.Command your allies throug the overview interface.If you encounter any issues please contact us at www.codeforgegames.com/support

reviews.title: Epic Game
reviews.comment: ^ Sure theres no sound during battles but other than that its awesome Oh and by the way, you tilt your device to steer. EPIC GAME
reviews.author: Eduardo Sandoval

reviews.title: Bad controls HUD/no sound
reviews.comment: Bad controls scheme, plus difficult HUD make it annoying to navigate this game. Add in a lack of in-game background track, plus massive unexplained game size, it really takes away from this game. Age of Wind 2 is a much smoother and intuitive game...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Mixed Thoughts
reviews.comment: If you\'re happy to accept unrealistically swift ships and impossibly tight turning circles then this is quite a nice game. The graphics are simple but very attractive, and the controls are clear and straightforward. Having said that, I shan\'t be buying the full version, partly because I found mission 4 impossibly hard after sailing through the first three (pun intended), and partly because of a number of shortcomings that let the game down.  Firstly the text is both a little hammy and in need of the attentions of a spell checker. Then there is the matter of the game playing \"upside down\" on my tablet (a Nexus 10). Of course I can invert my tablet, but there is already code in the game to use the orientation sensor so it could easily be fixed. Finally the strategic map is very shabby compared to the main game graphics. As well as needing some more details, its scroll control is way too sensitive and it needs a zoom control. Oh, and for a game that has you holding your tablet like a steering wheel it would be much nicer if the cannon controls were under your left and right thumbs instead of in the lower-right corner.  I trust others will have better luck with mission 4!
reviews.author: Rob Dixon

reviews.title: Looks great, but doesn\'t work right.
reviews.comment: First mission - I don\'t see my own ship or the enemy pinnace, only their shadow and wake. Strange, because the three Spanish merchants are rendered nicely. OK, still playable. Second mission - my ship is still missing, but the view get obstructed by some single-color triangles, which are clearly not supposed to be there. Also, no exit button? Do I really have to use an appkiller every time I stop playing this? No, thank you.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: slowed down my phone enormously....cant understand why.  its size shows vastly diff. amts in various folders+lists...all of this rendered me unable to get much play time.  some clean up would presumably make this way cool.

reviews.title: Good idea bad controls
reviews.comment: Tilt controls feel too clunky, I would have preferred onscreen controls via something like a ghost joystick. And more like Zelda wind waker.

reviews.title: A lot of bugs
reviews.comment: This app at first was fun like a five star app and then  I opened it up and it turned my phone off and it wouldn\'t let me play.
